title: My reaction to every champ release
body:
1. (Before Champ is released) - Wow that champ looks really cool I want to buy them.
2. (When I play against champ) - Oh wow this champion is really broken.
3. (After playing against champ) - There is no way I'm ever going to buy such an overpowered champ.
4. (After Not buying champ) - I didn't buy champ.

Rito please keep them in PBE longer and release champs that aren't so overpowered.

Exception: {{champion:432}} Love you bard <3

replies.body: The best way to test how good a champ is is by testing it with the general public, so i agree with them releasing the champion so early. My only thing is after a champs release they shouldn't be allowed to be in ranked until the next patch.

I agree with your first point but not the second. Disabling a champ from ranked for a patch 2-3 weeks is kind of severe. Some people, myself included, actually read up on and follow new champs from PBE to live. I practice a champion in a few custom and normal games before taking them to ranked where I can learn how the champion does in a more competitive setting. People who don't want to see new champions in ranked ban them it's really that simple.
The reason is so they can release a patch to fix their problems before allowing them to go into ranked extremely broken like in ekko's case or total garbage like in bard's case

Personally I don't think Ekko is broken, and the reason is he's not an assassin, he's a fighter, or bruiser if you will. Bard was pretty good on release as far as supporting goes, offering mobility and bonus XP to his ADC. New champs are called broken because the general community does not take much effort to learning the champions abilities or interactions. In the off chance that there is a game breaking bug the champ is usually disabled.

Bottom line is, if anyone gets wrecked by a new champion, it has more to do with lack of knowledge than numbers. Personally tired of people complaining that a new champion is OP. Community cries to Riot, they release nerfs, and the champion's original identity becomes murky, as seen with Aatrox, Rek'Sai, Azir, Gnar, Yasuo, and soon to be added Ekko. Which is the true tragedy.

lol are you serious? ekko was compeltely broken on release and riot knew it. Im sorry but if you can instantly gap close to an adc and kil lthem instantly you are an assassin. I have seen ekkos kill an adc with just their q e and passive like it was nothing. Secondly, bard was absolute trash tier on release and still is pretty bad. Why would i play him when i can just play soraka or sona who do his job 10 times better than he does. Had they had a patch of testing to the general public, maybe these things could of been avoided. Before you say ekko cant 100-0 an adc ill try and find the reddit post where they compared ekkos level 11 burst with every other mage in the game and he was 3rd behind malzahar and veigar.

Never said he couldn't burst other champions. I said he couldn't assassinate them. Assassinations in league have three parts. The pick, the kill, and the escape. If anyone lets an enemy champ, Ekko or anyone else, kill them in under three seconds and they aren't horribly behind, they need to learn how to ward and where to position themselves.

I find it simply hilarious whenever someone says a champ who is rendered useless by CC as weak as a snare is broken. Ekko wasn't broken, the champions who counter him enough to shut him down were forgotten.
{{champion:143}} Zone potential, Snares, ranged poke,
{{champion:127}} Zone, Gap Close, Ranged poke, Snare, Point and click ult stun.
{{champion:45}} Walking Tactical Nuke.

Ekko is a melee champ with high mana costs and a low mana pool. Arguing that his is broken based on the amount of burst he has isn't a good case. Especially when the skill floor to pull of his combos successfully, securing the kill, getting out alive, returning  applying pressure to his or other lanes, is so high.

I guess actually understanding his kit makes it difficult for me to see him as broken. A bit strong in the current meta yes, but still has a ton of counterplay.

> [{quoted}](name=TheUntitledKing,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=226HMO4V,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-06-19T05:38:20.204+0000)
>
> {{champion:90}}  Oh my Mr. Ekko, it seems you want to engage in close-quarters combat with me. Now, do come up nice and close while I quickly lay down all my skills in that spot you're currently standing in...
> 
> GRRAAAAAAHHHHHHH!
> 
> {{item:3070}} {{champion:245}} {{item:3070}}

{{champion:121}}  "Fear the Void~

except he fits the exact description of an assassin lol he can gap close(the pick) explode with insane damage (the kill) and ult and get away with 60% HP or more (the escape). Also for the record zyra does not counter him. Maybe pre 6 because her poke is annoying but not after that. Also an good ekko can dodge veigars ult with his ult and he will never be able to land his stun as ekkos blink goes through it and its on a much lower cooldown and veigar has 0 escapes. Lissandra i could see but simply listing someones counters doesnt make them weak lol thats like saying zed is weak because lissandra and kayle counter him. Every champ has coutners but forthe most part ekko can handle almost any matchup and doesnt need to even be that fed to obliterate an adc

Yeah, he can do tons of damage, but how fast can he do it compare to other assassins?

The only high damage part and things one needs to avoid are super slow.

His q might be hard to dodge, but the return takes a really long time. At least way more than 1 sec. The real damage of that q is its 0.6 AP scaling on the return. His passive also does a lot of damage too, but how is one supposed to stack 3 stacks in an assassin fitting time?

You can either stack double q, and e, but that takes a long time because the q return takes too long, the e has a dash before hand before casting the blink. Takes too long for an assassin.

Or you could autoattack twice, and then q, but how long is that going to take when attack speed isn't good on ekko?

Or you could input your w, which takes a whoppin 3 seconds to actually go in, and by the time, the entire team probably avoided the w, and that takes too long to.

Or you could cast your ult somehow into the enemy team and do tons of damage, but then you've lost your escape, and the ult's indicator is right there.

He fits his champion select quote perfectly, its not how much time you have, its how you use it. Ekko lacks the ability to do damage in a short amount of time, and therefore doesnt care how long it takes him to get a target. What he really cares though is how he uses the utility from his kit to kill priority target.

Ekko does a lot of damage for an assassin, but he lacks the speed to do all the damage at once. He is a pure utility assassin, using his utility to do damage, unlike other assassins who rely on burst damage. As long as one constantly moves around when ekko is near, Ekko has pretty much no match against them.
I applaud you. +1

Don't feel like extending this argument any further. Learn how leads work in this game, until then you won't understand why everything I've said is true. Your points seem to come from personal experience playing against this champion and less "AS" this champion. Educate yourself on how he works and you won't have any problem shutting him down as almost any champ.

your argument is inherently flawed though. You are saying "learn to play against the champ and you wont have problems" that can be applied to literally any champion, doesn't mean its viable. Zed in my opinion is the best all around mid laner in the game. Idc what you do there is no shutting down a good zed. Watch high elo games, zed is too good at everything, he will always be relavent in the game. Ekko si near the same, his kit allows him to always do a lot of damage and be relatively safe, with two great aoe team fight abilites that stun and heal him with a nuke. Ive played as ekko plenty of times and if you go look at my profile you will see i stomped with him in all but 1 game. My first game ever with him in ranked i got 22 kills, and funny thing is i was against veigar. Couldnt hit me with his stun ever because i would just e directly to him, so he would have to kill me with just q and e through my 300 shield at level 6 while hes stunned for over 2 seconds. Just can't do it. Also ekko is one of the best roamers in the game, if you counter him he will just roam and shit on other lanes or your jungler. There is a reason he has been out for only 2 weeks and his win rate went from 43 percent to 50. which is the 4th highest in league history behind Diana, Xin, and Rek'sai for WP increase afte rtwo weeks according to champion.gg
Dont forget Ahri.  She can outpoke him, which is his biggest weakness other then CC

Not true sadly. He blinks, the second he blinks (assuming he is good and procced his passive already) you just lost 50% of your hp or more. Ahri does not 100-0 people, she simply cannot without being massively ahead. So Ekko just did what Ahri would do, is in her face, outdamaging her (5% damage increase below 30% isn't hard)...I could go on. =(

Then you arent good with ahri.  If you are using your range correctly he should never be close enough to dash blick.  Your Q is similar to his with tru damage and faster.

Out poke him.

Also that 50%hp is gross exxageration.  As someone who takes Ahri every time enemy is ekko, you dont know what your talking about

What are you doing that I'm not? Honest question. I can never take Ahri mid against Zed/Yasuo/Ekko despite them being melee simply because, yes I have charm/orb, but once they get in my face they will beat my face. =/ I can play her against other mages (and Fizz somehow, weird...) but not against the melee ones. I rush Luden's, and buy extra doran's ring if I give first blood (which I do often, though I go very high via killing spree once I get my first 120 item). Help XD?

Yas I have trouble with as well, between the windwall and the really mobile dash.
Zed is ok, biggest problem on him I have is the shruiken spam, far more efficient then me using up all my mana. He can just outpoke before he all ins.

Ekko though is arguably less mobile/less safe.  
He has his dash thing, but its pretty low range and not up all that often.  And post 6 his ult of course.

But in lane its all about poke and cs.  Obviously dont run out of mana, dont oer do it, but you can get him low enough to kill semi often.  Doesnt mean you WILL, but you could.

Its all about that Q.  its just better then his.  More damage, faster projectile.  All about knowing your range to you hit him with it at the apex of the orb throw,dealing both damages right away.  Its equally as good farming waves as his Q, not sure which is better here, his seems to be a little wider.  But just play safe and outpoke him.  Ekko's will attempt to get up on you, but you are pretty mobile.  If he does get in hit a charm and back off.  Twin shadows is a good second item after ludens, more movement speed.  Dont feel like im explaining well but on painkillers for a bad tooth so haing trouble focusing >.<

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/nEB6E4GW-ekko-counterplay

A rather in depth post I made about playing against him, try that for a read
you fucking potato he can 1v4 and get out with 50% HP?
So can Kat. CC Kat and she is useless. CC Ekko he is useless. If I am a potato it seems that potatoes know a lot more about this game than you do.  Learn the game and you won't be one of those 4.
I suppose you're right but I would still much rather have an underpowered champ that gets buffed than an overpowered champ that gets nerfed

and then I play the champion and realise their weaknesses and play style.

Thank you Dota 2 for probably the best loading screen advice I have ever received for Moba:
> Often the best way to learn a Hero's weaknesses is to play them yourself.

How true that is.

Then you have those overly honourable narrow-minded fools who prefer to ban "freelo" instead of playing it once, getting stomped and as such learning champion's weaknesses.
Didn't {{champion:161}} come out of the oven perfectly balanced though?

V4.13:

Projectile will now split after Vel'Koz has died.

Copypasta'd right from the wiki.  The only things that were changed about him since he was added were very slight buffs.  

Look at him.  

Look at this perfect being.
Problem is no one wants to play him because he's outclassed by all these broken champs :(

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=226HMO4V,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2015-06-19T20:34:51.479+0000)
> Look at this perfect being.

{{champion:101}} *Grumbles*.
FYI, PBE isn't really for balancing, instead it is for bug testing.
well that's dumb :/

cant really look at balance issues when there is such a small pool of players on the pbe.  and before you say "get more players on the pbe" the servers aren't designed for it, are positioned for a small subset of players, and picking players who have sportsmanly play all add up to there being a small subset of players over there.
My reaction:
ZenonTheStoic confirmed the champion he is making has 3 passives.
That might just be a joke :|

I'd like to think it was a joke...but after seeing what CertainlyT gets away with all the time, and then Ekko coming to the live servers as is, I'm not sure anymore.  My only hope is that if he has 3 passives, at least one of his abilities can't be activated.
it's Zenon the stoic, the most "Overloaded" thing he's added is azir's second passive which justgives AS for CDR.

Every time CertainlyT makes a champion I cringe for this reason except for the first one because at this point I don't even want to see what he's working on next.  I still don't own, nor will I ever own Yasuo or Kalista because I feel that they will never be champions to me until their toxic kits have been reworked from the ground up. 

I'd still not own Ekko, but I believe Gypsylord actually has a degree of humility and a certain level of sympathy for those who have to play against the kits he designs, and will adjust his champions if they're too strong.  He's taking his time with Ekko though...he still needs looked at quite a bit.  (3 slows, a big-ass shield, an execute, a speedup, a blink, an "oops" button that heals him and does more damage than Vieg in an AoE on an ASSASSIN?  _Really??_)

New champion releases like Bard's are great for an introduction to the roster because they arrive border-line useless and might as well count for the sixth member of the enemy team.  That's good!  Now they can be buffed just enough that they don't get pushed over the edge of balance, while still being strong enough to benefit the team they're on.

Yasuo's kit is toxic, that is just outright wrong. His kit is like nerfed to the ground. Have you seen the numbers for both high elo and low elo. His windwall is useless early on. His E is horrible for extended mobility. His Q only source of damage, and his tornado easily dodged. Yasuo is trash tier now.

>Yasuo's kit is toxic, that is just outright wrong. His kit is like nerfed to the ground

Why was it nerfed to the ground?  Because it's toxic to the core...
Because the vocal minority refused to learn how to abuse his non-existent laning phase.
Riot doesn't balance their champs based on the "vocal minority" but rather play testers, pro players and raw aggregate data.

Even so, that doesn't mean they can correctly evaluate that information. Ironically Yasuo is a proof of that.

I called it like half a year ago, that Yasuo banrate will only drop if he will be removed from the game (_Which won't happen obviously_), half of his kit will be removed (_Was close, but not close enough_) or when a much more powerful or obnoxious champion will be released (_Hi, Ekko_).

Guess I'm some kind of a medium.

Well yes, if you remove parts of a champ's kit that makes them ban-worthy or priority bans, then their banrate will indeed drop.  It doesn't take much to understand that.  And yes, if a champ that's stronger than your current ban list is released, it will bump someone off the list.  

I know you're being sarcastic, but you're no medium.  You made blanket statements that anyone with a pulse and a functional brain also said.  I see no reason to respond to my comment with sarcasm anyway - I was just making a factual statement.

What this guy says. Every Yasuo who gets fed at mid either had his jungle camp or the enemy jungle never came and ganked. Yasuo has to be aggro to win the lane and an aggro Yasuo is easy pickings for a jungler.

> [{quoted}](name=Keevalroy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=226HMO4V,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-06-18T23:45:11.600+0000)

I still don't own, nor will I ever own Yasuo or Kalista because I feel that they will never be champions to me until their toxic kits have been reworked from the ground up.

He's taking his time with Ekko though...he still needs looked at quite a bit.  (3 slows, a big-ass shield, an execute, a speedup, a blink, an "oops" button that heals him and does more damage than Vieg in an AoE on an ASSASSIN?  _Really??_)

> New champion releases like Bard's are great for an introduction to the roster because they arrive border-line useless and might as well count for the sixth member of the enemy team.  That's good!  Now they can be buffed just enough that they don't get pushed over the edge of balance, while still being strong enough to benefit the team they're on.

I personally don't like the "released UP to be buffed" idea. I mean, look at Quinn. That poor girl hasn't EVER gotten attention in all her years on the Rift. Being a tad strong then nerfed into balance at least sorta guarantees that he/she/it will remain playable. Of course you could just have releases like Vel'Koz, the perfectly Balanced Champ sent from the heavens.
Most champions suck upon release btw
not ekko

> [{quoted}](name=Snake Town,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=226HMO4V,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-06-18T18:48:58.675+0000)
>
> Rito please keep them in PBE longer and release champs that aren't so overpowered.

That doesn't make them balanced.

The PBE is a small section of the community that can't account for how everyone will try to play a champion. It also doesn't show how everyone plays *against* a champion. It can give an educated guess at best, but the actual community reaction is something needed to gauge the balance of a champion, and the PBE just doesn't quite have the millions of players that the core community has.
do people want a reward for not playing "broken" champs??? like jesus christ...get over yourselves..
We're not trying to make ourselves seem "better", we just want a game where most champions in the game are on a similar playing field potential wise.
